attributes.action: have at least basic Welsh/Gaelic taught to school children throughout the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Welsh, Gaelic, Cornish and other minority Celtic languages are an important part of our country's heritage, but they have been almost completely replaced by English. Surely it is only fair that schoolchildren around Britain, including England, should leearn at the least some simple Welsh and Gaelic; some of the mixed feelings between Wales, England, Scotland and Northern Ireland are down to the fact that we don't understand each other's heritage, culture and identity enough, and language plays an important part in this.
